projects.title: Bachelor Thesis
projects.desc: An Artificial Neural Network based adaptive non-linear control strategy, with highlight on its capability as a compliant control scheme. The thesis involved simulation and control design, mechanical and PCB design, with custom embedded software.

projects.title: Vincent™
projects.desc: An AI system that turns sketches into art. It utilises a GAN architecture to mimic human creativity and imagination. I developed the training code that made us able to efficiently experiment with new ideas by scaling up the training to utilize the internal infrastructure. A writeup is available here.

projects.title: Master Thesis
projects.desc: Dynamic Gain Scheduling control for the Bixler aircraft in highly non-linear flight conditions. The project included simulation and control design, custom sensor design and integration and software implementation on the on-board flight controller.

projects.title: Electric hokey cart
projects.desc: An electric wheelchair for disabled people to play indoor hokey. I worked on the control system, embedded controller and the power-electronics.

projects.title: Deepray™
projects.desc: An AI system that reconstructs highly distorted images in real-time. Using a GAN it can go beyond simple image restoration when huge amount of information is lost. It is able to fill up missing details in a context aware way that it learnt from the training dataset. I worked on adding ideas from the state-of-the-art research with combination of novel methods to our model. A writeup is available here.

projects.title: Internship at DroneX
projects.desc: I worked on control algorithms and software for drones and bipedal systems. Also, I had the chance to experience working in a dynamic start-up environment.

projects.title: Multidisciplinary optimisation
projects.desc: A satellite coverage project that involved a multi-step design process with optimisation in each step to get the best possible coverage for the given constraints.

projects.title: EMICAB
projects.desc: EMICAB was an international collaborative research project to develop a hexapod robot. I was working on a novel tactile sensitive fingertip design for the legs.

projects.title: Drone simulation
projects.desc: A simulation environment in Gazebo with the corresponding controller in Simulink communicating over ROS. It was developed for the IMAV 2017 student competition.

projects.title: The kidnapped robot
projects.desc: A project to address the kidnapped robot problem, involving autonomous localisation and mapping in an uncertain environment.

projects.title: Robot kinematics and dynamics
projects.desc: Simulation and control for several different robotic arm configurations.

projects.title: Stepladder climber
projects.desc: A university project to build a robot that can climb a stepladder with very tight size and weight constraints.

projects.title: Humanoid robot design
projects.desc: System architecture design of a humanoid walking robot for iRobotx. I developed the simulation and prototyped the real-time control algorithm using Simulink, and developed the Linux middleware for the actuators and sensors on the on-board controller.

projects.title: Racing with Sphero
projects.desc: The project was developed as a technical demonstration at the MathWorks. I worked on setting up the arena for racing with Spheros and testing the software developed in MATLAB. A writeup is available here.

projects.title: Machine learning based drug discovery
projects.desc: GTN was a startup for machine learning based drug discovery where I contributed as a freelancer. I worked on software engineering and DevOps for large scale cluster systems to support the research team. The tools included Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Ray Tune, and GCP services.

projects.title: Mergers and acquisitions search tool
projects.desc: I worked on an internal tool for a mergers and acquisitions firm that helped them to pair pontetial buyers and sellers. The tool gathered relevant data from a company database and provided a list of the most relevant stakeholders. The work involved developing a webapp using Flask, Celery and MySQL.

projects.title: Property crawler
projects.desc: I worked on a tool for myself as a side-project, that scraped and presented the most relevant ads on the property market for renting. With this tool it was significantly faster to swift through the large amount of properties in London and rate them automatically based on the price, size and commute distance tailored to our needs.

projects.title: Heterogenous graph learning
projects.desc: As part of my PhD, I worked on a project that addressed semi-supervised node prediction on heterogeneous graphs, e.g. predicting a genre of a movie based on its connections to other movies and ratings from users. The results were summarised in a paper published at AAAI 2021.

projects.title: Automation of algorithmic trading infrastructure
projects.desc: I worked with Brainpool on their Forstack product to automate the retraining and deployment pipeline. I used Kubernetes, Helm and Argo for combining the subsystems to create a robust and fast pipeline.

projects.title: Order book based price prediction
projects.desc: I worked for a client on a price prediction machine learning model based on fine-grained data (asks, bids and trades). The project posed additional challenges due to the unevenly spaced data, in comparison to OHLCV data that has a constant sampling frequency.

projects.title: Crypto-currency trading bot
projects.desc: I worked on a crypto trading bot that utilizes the state-of-the-art in deep learning for time series prediction. The model also utilizes some additional preprocessing techniques with a set of technical indicators.

projects.title: Pupil distance measurement tool
projects.desc: I worked on an webapp that measures the pupil distance of a user from an image. A combination of machine learning techniques and more traditional image processing tools were used to achieve the required accuracy.

projects.title: Trading bot based on arbitrage
projects.desc: I developed a trading bot for a client that utilised market inefficiencies in the form of arbitrage. The speed of decision making was crucial, so the pipeline was written in highly optimised C++ with multi-threaded execution of the workload and asynchronous communication with the crypto-currency marketplace.

projects.title: Business development for dotData
projects.desc: I worked as business developer to promote the autoML platform dotData (an NEC spinoff) in the UK.

projects.title: Competitive multi-agent reinforcement learning challenge
projects.desc: I participated in a challenge at the Alan Turing Institute as a facilitator, which was about developing novel RL agents to compete againts each other in Hunting the Plark. Our team explored graph-based state representations and graph neural networks to learn the optimal policy, which showed promising results.

projects.title: Simple Playgroungs reinforcement learning environment
projects.desc: I contributed to the Simple Playgrounds RL environment, which was designed to be fast, scalable and customizable to make a broad range of RL research more achievable.

academic.title: HetSAGE: Heterogenous Graph Neural Network for Relational Learning
academic.authors: V. Jankovics, M. Garcia Ortiz, E. Alonso

academic.title: Artificial neural network based compliant control for robot arms
academic.authors: V. Jankovics, S. Mátéfi-Tempfli and P. Manoonpong

academic.title: High resolution tactile sensors for curved robotic fingertips
academic.authors: A. Drimus, V. Jankovics, M. Gorsic, S. Mátéfi-Tempfli

academic.title: Novel high resolution tactile robotic fingertips
academic.authors: A. Drimus, V. Jankovics, M. Gorsic. S. Mátéfi-Tempfli
